title: Commending Karolyn Grimes for special recognition for her role in the Seneca Falls "It's a Wonderful Life" Annual Celebration
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION commending Karolyn Grimes for special recognition
for  her  role  in the Seneca Falls "It's a Wonderful Life" Annual Cele-
bration to be held December 10-12, 2010

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to honor and pay  just
tribute  to those individuals whose creative talents have contributed to
the cultural enrichment of the citizens of the State of New York; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full  accordance  with  its
long-standing  traditions,  this  Legislative  Body  is  justly proud to
recognize Karolyn Grimes for her contributions to the Seneca Falls "It's
a Wonderful Life" Annual Celebration, held December 10-12, 2010; and
  WHEREAS, Each year at Christmastime, the Finger Lakes village of Sene-
ca Falls is transformed into Bedford Falls, a  sleepy  village  complete
with  white  lights  and wreaths strung across the main street and where
Karolyn Grimes, the childhood actress who portrayed Zuzu Bailey  in  the
iconic  film,  "It's  a Wonderful Life," returns for this annual holiday
celebration; and
  WHEREAS, Seneca Falls has many similarities to Bedford Falls,  includ-
ing  the  traditional  main  street, the steel truss bridge where George
Bailey jumped into the water and the many Second Empire Victorian  homes
like the large, old Granville house in the movie; and
  WHEREAS,  The  community  of  Seneca  Falls believes it to be the true
inspiration for director Frank Capra's imaginary Bedford Falls  and  the
setting for the sentimental holiday classic "It's a Wonderful Life"; and
  WHEREAS,  Karolyn  Grimes  grew  up  in  Hollywood and was coaxed into
acting by her mother; at the age of six,  she  landed  the  heartwarming
role  of Zuzu Bailey, the daughter of George and Mary Bailey, and became
famous for her inspirational line in the movie, "Every time a bell rings
an angel gets his wings,"; and
  WHEREAS, After acting in  "It's  a  Wonderful  Life",  Karolyn  Grimes
finished school, college, married and raised a family; and
  WHEREAS,  As  a reminder of her role in the movie, Karolyn Grimes kept
all the newspaper clippings and pictures from her role in the  film  and
they  remained there until 1980, when a reporter came to her door asking
her if she was the little girl in the movie, "It's  a  Wonderful  Life";
and
  WHEREAS, Karolyn Grimes became an ambassador for the film and embodies
all that Zuzu Bailey represents; Karolyn Grimes inspires many smiles and
lots of joy, truly believing in her mission to spread the word that life
is a wonderful gift; and
  WHEREAS, Karolyn Grimes is very much at home in Seneca Falls, with its
snowy  sidewalks,  decorated  windows,  old-fashioned  street lights and
wreaths hanging overhead; and
  WHEREAS, A community is only as great as the individuals, who, through
their unique personal talents and achievements, contribute to the commu-
nity's unique character; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
commend  Karolyn Grimes for special recognition for her contributions to
the Seneca Falls "It's a Wonderful Life" Annual Celebration; and  be  it
further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Karolyn Grimes.
